definitions.text: a loud utterance; often in protest or opposition
examples: the speaker was interrupted by loud cries from the rear of the audience

definitions.text: a loud utterance of emotion (especially when inarticulate)
a slogan used to rally support for a cause
the characteristic utterance of an animal

examples: she cried with pain when the doctor inserted the needle
I yelled to her from the window but she couldn't hear me

definitions.text: shed tears because of sadness, rage, or pain
examples: She cried bitterly when she heard the news of his death
The girl in the wheelchair wept with frustration when she could not get up the stairs

definitions.text: utter aloud; often with surprise, horror, or joy
examples: `I'm here,' the mother shouted when she saw her child looking lost
before we had newspapers, a town crier would cry the news
He cried his merchandise in the market square
This situation is crying for attention

definitions.text: bring into a particular state by crying
examples: The little boy cried himself to sleep
